intro: Launaea pycnocephala, commonly known as the thick-headed dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Africa, the Middle East, and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and robust, hairy stems. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with thick, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in dry environments. Its bright yellow flowers bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Launaea pycnocephala is adapted to survive in harsh conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
